docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
There are a couple of ways to install Draw On Your Screen. This will depend on your version of GNOME.

There are Many GNOME Versions!

To find out your version of GNOME open a terminal and type gnome-shell --version or go to Settings > System > About > System Details(1).

  1. Another fun way is to use the neofetch program!

docs.title: Installation Methods for GNOME v47 and v46
docs.text:
Upcoming E.G.O. Approval

We are working on getting the extension approved by GNOME so that it will be listed on:

https://extensions.gnome.org (known as E.G.O.)

Stay tuned!

docs.title: Option 1: Use the Automated Script
docs.text:
This method will work for any version of GNOME between v42 and v47.

  1. Copy the following command to your Bash terminal and press enter to run it:

    bash <(wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/daveprowse/scripts/refs/heads/main/doys-install.sh)

    Warning

    IMPORTANT!! Always check scripts before running them! If you are uncomfortable running the script, or cannot run the script, then install manually with Option #2 below.

    The script will identify your version of GNOME (if it is between v42 and v47) and install the correct version of the extension automatically.

  2. When the installation process is complete, logout and log back in.

  3. Then, enable the extension:

    • In the CLI:

      gnome-extensions enable draw-on-your-screen3@daveprowse.github.io

    • In the GUI

      • Open the GNOME Extensions App:

        gnome-extensions-app

      • Locate Draw On Your Screen 3 and enable it.

        Tip

        You can install the Gnome Extensions App package within your Linux distribution(1).

        1. For example:
          • in Ubuntu: sudo apt install gnome-shell-extensions-prefs
          • in Fedora: sudo dnf install gnome-extensions-app.

  4. Use the tool by pressing Super + Alt + D.

Remember that this extension has a minimalist "look". Everything is controlled via keyboard shortcuts.(1)

  1. To view all of the shortcuts while working in the extension press Ctrl + F1.

Have fun!

docs.title: Option 2: Install Manually from the Release or Repository Branch
docs.text:
Note

For GNOME versions other than 47 & 46, see Other GNOME Versions below.

  1. Download or clone the extension.

    Download option:

    wget https://github.com/daveprowse/DrawOnYourScreen3/releases/download/v15.0-GNOME-v47/GNOMEv47.tar.xz

    Then, decompress the tar file:

    tar -xvf GNOMEv47.tar.xz

    Clone option:

    git clone https://github.com/daveprowse/DrawOnYourScreen3

  2. Place the directory (the one that contains metadata.json) in ~/.local/share/gnome-shell/extensions

  3. Change the directory name to draw-on-your-screen3@daveprowse.github.io

  4. Restart your session:

    • (Wayland) - Log out and log back in
    • (Xorg) - Type alt + F2 and r to restart the gnome-shell

  5. Enable the extension with GNOME Extensions command or application

  6. Super + Alt + D to test

Issues? Let us know at this link.

ENJOY!

docs.title: Other GNOME Versions
docs.text: If you prefer not to use the script above, and have an older version of GNOME, choose from a download method below and then follow steps 2 through 6 above.

docs.title: GNOME v45
docs.text:
Download or clone this repository branch

  • Download option:

    wget https://github.com/daveprowse/DrawOnYourScreen3/releases/download/v14.0-GNOME-v45/GNOMEv45.tar.xz

Then, decompress the tar file: tar -xvf GNOMEv45.tar.xz

  • Clone option:

    git clone -b GNOMEv45 https://github.com/daveprowse/DrawOnYourScreen3
